vocabulary.definition: the act of giving someone official permission or approval to do something
vocabulary.example: Without proper authorization, no one can access the nuclear weapons.

vocabulary.definition: a group of vehicles or ships traveling together for mutual support and protection
vocabulary.example: The convoy consisted of armored vehicles transporting the nuclear cargo.

vocabulary.definition: easily affected or offended; requiring careful handling
vocabulary.example: The convoy carried sensitive nuclear materials through the city.

vocabulary.definition: official rules or guidelines that explain how to do something in a specific situation
vocabulary.example: The agents followed strict protocols to ensure the safety of the nuclear transport.

vocabulary.definition: people who enter a place without permission, especially in order to commit a crime
vocabulary.example: The security system sprayed foam on the intruders trying to access the cargo hold.

vocabulary.definition: unable to be moved; firmly fixed in place
vocabulary.example: The vehicle became immovable after the explosives destroyed the axle.
